data.title: Best Cheesesteak in GA
data.text: This was possibly the best cheesesteak I have had since moving away from the Philly area seven years ago.  The meat was just right, and theI am working in Albany this week and am so glad I found you!  The cookies were amazing, and obviously homemade.  I'm an oatmeal fan, and they were soft, moist, and flavorful.  I saw a review mention a "grumpy owner" and I disagree.  More like Luke from Gilmore Girls.  He made a good recommendation when I asked, and it was spot on.  Parking is available across the street in the municipal garage or a little parking lot next to it.  If it were not so far form Atlanta, I'd be here weekly.

data.title: Local breakfast and lunch spot
data.text: There are not any standout dishes at this iconic local restaurant. I do believe the only place in town you can get baklava.  This restaurant is an Albany Icon it is unique little dive worth a visit. It is kind of endearing in its own way with a grumpy owner that will put you in your place if you don't have your act together when it is time to order or pay.  It's hard to find parking at times, but it is like walking into a time capsule.  Old newspapers hanging on the wall as far back as WWII interesting reading.  The decor and atmosphere make you fell as if you walked out of your current world and walked into the 1940's.  They have pretty good breakfast and fresh baked cookies, and I always buy some when I go there. The sandwiches you could make yourself, but their vegetable soup is fairly tasty.   This restaurant is not a fantastic place to eat; I don't go there for the food, but more for an experience.  Except when I want baklava or want to hang out with a friend and chat over a cup of coffee.  I also enjoy going there alone and hanging out when I just want a break from it all, maybe reading about all the wars and stuff puts all your issues into perspective and makes you a little more thankful. I love the little place, but I just don't want to mislead anyone about the food it is just regular food.

data.title: Great Sandwich but disappointed in the cookie 🙃👎🏼
data.text: This was my first visit here. I ordered The Turkey and Swiss asked for it to be grilled! Added Tom, Let and Mayo on Rye! It was excellent! I love the thin bread  and it was perfectly grilled. I   Also ordered PB cookie and Chocolate chip cookies. To Go. When I arrived to my destination I realized the Chocolate chip had nuts in them 😔😩👎🏼 and I am allergic to nuts. I wish they would have told me or have it listed on the name. The PB cookies were good. I will be back again it would be great if they actually read this and change how they list their menu items.

data.title: Good eats and more than just cookies.
data.text: Great place for a lunch to go downtown or cookies for a pick me up. Has that real local vibe about it. It is a nice treat if you have jury duty as well. It is a short walk from the courthouse and you don't have to lose your hard won parking space. Give it a try, ; you just might like it.

data.title: Gem of Albany
data.text: I absolutely love this place and I'm a little mad at myself for not finding it earlier...I had no idea this place existed until my wife showed it to me while running errands downtown...The staff is awesome and the older woman who I refer to as "Mama" is in charge...She is a very friendly woman who makes you feel right at home...The food is AMAZING!!! We can about four or five days in a row just randomly trying different things on the menu and loved it all...My favorite was the Reuben on rye...I know a lot of places probably make this but its rare to find a place in the South that does it right...The Chili is also out of this world as well...The hours are a little weird and the seating is a mess (Because it so close together, and usually packed with people) but these are probably the only flaws I can find...Plus don't forget about the cookies!!!!!!!!

data.title: Need lunch in downtown?
data.text: The Cookie shop is a misnomer. Yes, they have cookies, but this is the place all the business folks go to have a great deli sandwich. It's crowded, noisy, and the Boss Lady might even give you a little grief if you can't make up your mind quick enough, but I love it. Try the Reuben or a Sub. They have good soups, too. This is closest thing to a Manhatten deli you will find in Southwest Ga.  Katt's Deli, watch out!

data.title: An Outstanding Eatery with a bag of chips
data.text: The Cookie Shoppe actually has a daily variety of cookies and kosher rated eats. The food is delicious. Their soup De Jour  can run from Chili to potato soup that is excellent. My favorite dish is the Tuna Salad on Toast special that comes with drink, chips and yes, a cookie. A great place to eat for the locals and tourist as well. Get there in time they generally close at 3p.m. Seating is cafe style and the walls are adorned with historical newspapers and other paraphernalia of a by-gone era. A lot of orders are call in and take out but sit and soak up the local lore. Must see in Albany.

data.title: "More Than a Cookie Shoppe"
data.text: I honestly enjoy the food here every time I come. I place orders a lot when I'm in a rush and can't sit in for lunch. But when I'm there, it's like a scene from the "Seinfeld Show." The lady behind the cash register runs a smooth operation and keeps everything and everyone ship top. The atmosphere is friendly and it's so easy to strike up a conversation with anyone. I love the vegetable soup with the big potato inside and the chicken salad sandwich with chips on the side...it's the best!

data.title: Fantastic lunch and warm staff
data.text: This is a wonderful local place to get food and have a great conversation. The grilled pimento cheese with bacon and tomato was beyond amazing. They were out of chocolate chip cookies, but the ones we had we lovely!

data.title: Great pimento cheese
data.text: The pimento cheese was awesome. Get the combo with chips a drink, soup and cookies. Great real southern food

data.title: Great hole in the wall
data.text: Cookies are off the chain. But the sandwiches fabulous. Get the egg salad. Be ready to order when u get to the front. Or no soup for you.

data.title: Happy to find Soup in Albany!
data.text:
This little place has been around for awhile.  It is great to find a place in Albany that sells soup.  We have tried several kinds and every kind we tried was good.  

What is not to like about cookies--big perk!

data.title: Gem of a spot in downtown
data.text:
The family that runs The Cookie Shoppe has been doing this for years.  Another reviewer was correct by saying that even repeat customers might not be acknowledged.  However, you can tell that they are appreciative of your business.  I heard the matriarch of the place saying hello to specific customers by name.  The sandwiches are awesome to me with very fresh bread and meat.  The pimento cheese is fabulous!  My mother had a BLT which she said was great also.  
The space is small and difficult to find a place to sit for parties of more than three or four.  But seeing all of the old newspapers on the wall helps you to understand the originality of the restaurant.  Needless to say, I will be going back soon!

A tip for first timers would be to review the menu before going into the restaurant as you will be somewhat rushed to order.  
Also, the kids menu is somewhat limited.  So, if chicken fingers are all your child will eat, let them each before they go.

data.title: Average experience for Albany
data.text: The sandwiches are decent. The cookies are great. The services is OKAY on a good day. The space is cramped, and the cashier (possibly the owner) is RUDE. Even if you are a regular (I've visited this place multiple times, and the lady just doesn't have a very good personality). The prices are not too expensive, but you would probably do better visiting the Subway across the street.

data.title: Consistently Good
data.text: I am always pleased with my lunch here. The sandwiches are excellent and the soup is homemade goodness... especially the cream of broccoli soup. The cookies are the perfect ending to the perfect lunch. You won't be disappointed with lunch or breakfast here. They are always busy because they have great food that keep customers craving more.

data.title: Greek with a southern twist
data.text: Yes, they make cookies like my grandmother did.  And they always have fresh baklava. (the owners are greek)  But my favorite thing is the pimento cheese.  The tuna salad is also a big hit with most.  Nothing fancy about this place and it's tiny but it's good for a sandwich or combo lunch.

data.title: A Great Place
data.text: The Cookie Shoppe is open for breakfast and lunch only, and is fantastic!  Freash food (including a large variety of cookies) made daily on site, owners who get to know the regulars, extremely reasonable prices, and outstanding cheese biscuits made by Mona which are available only on Fridays.  OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!!

data.title: Cookie shoppe is an understatement
data.text:
If in Albany this is the place
We are talking old school 70's style walk up and order.who calls cold cut subs a submarine? Love it!!
Full breakfast and lunch and everything made here.
So their cookies are famous I guess but lunch was excellent

Egg salad sandwich,chips,fresh chicken rice soup two of their cookies and aa soda for 8.50
They also make their baklava which I took home for the drive.

Why eat here? You want old fashion but clean with great lunch breakfast or cookies? Then come here

Why not? N/A

data.title: Fabulous!
data.text: By far the best breakfast biscuits I have ever tasted! Friendly environment. Small town feel. Lunch menu is also very tasty! I eat here often!
